instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 ripped G3H components, fixable?
threads.message:
Got a 820-00165 board, liquid damaged. Back of the board looks new with no corrosion, the front has burned components, and the previous owner ripped some of the G3H components while cleaning the board.

all the pads of the missing components are missing too, is it still fixable if so what should I do?

threads.title: 820-00165 ripped G3H components, fixable?
threads.message: This looks like heavy corrosion in many places. I don't think that I would bother but it all depends on how much time you have to waste. It could be fixable, but if you have more work to do I would pass on this one.

threads.title: 820-00165 ripped G3H components, fixable?
threads.message: How can i solder the components with all pads missing? do i just run jumpers?

threads.title: 820-00165 ripped G3H components, fixable?
threads.message: Well yes that would be the only way, that's why I said this board is a time waster project.
